page.title: 14 HOUSING TYPES
page.content: First of all we made master copy of a survey sheet with columns to tick.We then had it photocopied,so we could all have copies of it.Next we went out and started a walk through a part of Newmarket,a housing estate called Studlands Park and then through Exning. On these sheets there were columns for different types of houses,ages of houses and what was used to build them. We drew some rough sketches of some of the houses that we saw. The most popular type of home in this area is terraces taking up 41% of the count,as they are less expensive to buy.Detached types come next with 22%. After this comes bungalows with 18%, then semi-detached with 15% and last of all flats and maisonettes with 2% each. This is because there is now room to build separate houses on the land.
